title:
Oscillatory dependence of tunneling magnetoresistance on barrier
  thickness in magnetic tunnel junctions
abstract:
The dependence of tunneling conductance and tunneling magnetoresistance (TMR)
on barrier thickness in magnetic tunnel junctions is theoretically
investigated. The complex band structure of the insulator is taken into
account, and an analytical formula for tunneling conductance and TMR is
derived. Numerical calculations using a tight-binding model validate the
analytical formula. The complex nature of insulator's band structure leads to
significant oscillations in tunneling conductance and TMR as functions of
barrier thickness. It is demonstrated that these TMR oscillations are not
caused by quantum confinement within the barrier, but are instead analogous to
classical two-slit optical interference.
